intro: Leptinella reptans, commonly known as the creeping snowbell, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silky hairs. Leptinella reptans thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
